intro: Prestonia purpurissata, commonly known as the purple-stemmed prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, which are often covered in a distinctive purple or reddish hue. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature showy, five-petaled blooms in shades of pink or white. Prestonia purpurissata is often found in moist, tropical environments and can grow as a shrub or small tree.
